intro: Symplocos divaricativena, commonly known as the variable symplocos, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is characterized by its small, elliptic leaves that are usually arranged alternately along the stems. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, typically blooming in the spring. Its fruits are small berries that mature to a red or orange color, attracting various bird species. Symplocos divaricativena is native to Southeast Asia and thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forests and undergrowth.
